meanings.definition: Accustom (someone) to something, especially something unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: The cold weather inures us to the harsh conditions of winter.
meanings.sent2: Regular exercise inures the body to physical exertion over time.
meanings.sent3: The spicy food inures my taste buds to the heat, making everything else taste bland.
meanings.sent4: Facing challenges inures us to adversity, making us stronger in the long run.
meanings.sent5: The daily practice inures her mind to stress, allowing her to stay calm in difficult situations.

meanings.definition: Become beneficial or advantageous over time.
meanings.sent1: Consistent savings inures to financial stability in the future.
meanings.sent2: Hard work inures to success in the long term.
meanings.sent3: Eating healthy food inures to improved overall well-being.
meanings.sent4: Positive thinking inures to a happier outlook on life.
meanings.sent5: Regular practice inures to mastery of a skill or craft over time.

meanings.sent1: The medication takes time to inures and show its benefits.
meanings.sent2: The new policy will inures once it is officially implemented.
meanings.sent3: The changes inures gradually, leading to a noticeable improvement.
meanings.sent4: The decision inures immediately, impacting the outcome significantly.
meanings.sent5: The training program inures quickly, resulting in visible progress.
